intro: Chaenocephalus lobatus var. brachyphyllus, commonly known as the short-leafed chaenocephalus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers. It is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
